Comment.value: Bookshelf script (spawns in books or a mage scroll).

This chest will spawn either a fixed amount of loot from a loot bin, or a random amount. The two choices may be freely combined (for instance, 1 fixed loot + 0-3 random loot).

Once all loot is taken from the chest, it will not spawn anymore for a fixed amount of time. If no time is defined, 20 minutes is the default.



Variables
------


TimeLimit (float): defines how long it takes for the next batch of loot to spawn. This is in SECONDS (i.e. 60.0 = one minute ). Optional - default is 1200.0.

RandomLoot (int): defines the upper integer of how much random loot you want to spawn (i.e., putting in 3 would spawn 0-3 random loot pieces). Optional - default is 0.

FixedLoot (int): defines how much loot you always want spawned. This can be combined with RandomLoot. Optional - default is 0.

LootLevel (int): defines which level of loot bin to be used. 1 is uber low, 3 is medium, 5 is uber, etc. Required - the chest will not work if LootLevel is not set from 1 to 5.

Place this waypoint in an area as a target for the spawns scripts. You can place as many of them as you want. The spawn scripts pick up to 4 spawnpoints an area to spawn creatures on as long as there's one or more PCs in the area.

Place this waypoint in an area as a target for the spawns scripts. You can place as many of them as you want. The spawn scripts pick up to 4 spawnpoints an area to spawn creatures on as long as there's one or more PCs in the area.

Place this waypoint in an area as a target for the spawns scripts. You can place as many of them as you want. The spawn scripts pick up to 4 spawnpoints an area to spawn creatures on as long as there's one or more PCs in the area.

This is the default waypoint you may place to set a patrol path for a creature or NPC.
1. Create the creature and either use its current Tag or fill in a new one.
2. Place or make sure the WalkWayPoints() is within the body of the On Spawn script for the creature.
3. Place a series of waypoints along the route you wish the creature to walk.
4. Select all of the newly created waypoints and right click. Choose the Create Set option.
5. The waypoint set will have a set name of "WP_" + NPC Tag. Thus if an NPC with the Tag "Guard" will have a waypoint set called "WP_Guard". Note that Tags are case sensitive.
